clinical_study.brief_title: A Virtual Reality System for Pain and Anxiety Management During Outpatient Hysteroscopy
clinical_study.official_title: A Virtual Reality System for Pain and Anxiety Management During Outpatient Hysteroscopy

brief_summary.textblock: To evaluate the effectiveness of VR as a distraction technique in the management of acute pain and anxiety during operative hysteroscopy in the outpatient setting.

detailed_description.textblock: A prospective, open-label, randomized control trial in a tertiary university-affiliated medical center between April to August 2020. Overall, 100 women will be randomly allocated to undergo operative hysteroscopy either with the use of VR (study group) or with standard treatment (control group). The primary outcome measures includ self-reported pain, anxiety scores, and vital parameters as pulse rate (PR) and respiratory rate (RR). Pain and anxiety outcomes were measured as numeric rating scores.

primary_outcome.measure: Assessments of pain through physiological parameters
primary_outcome.description: Assessments of pain through physiological parameters of pulse rate. Heart Rate will be measured using Heart Rate-beats per minute.

primary_outcome.measure: Assessments of pain through pain score parameter
primary_outcome.description: Assessments of pain through pain score parameter of the NRS questionnaire. Pain will be measured using the Numeric Rating Scale (NRS) which is a 11 point scale from 0 to 10 which is a validated score of measuring pain and anxiety in which 0 is no pain and 10 is the worst imaginable pain and or anxiety.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

Exclusion Criteria:
